column2: Writing user input directly to an HTTP response allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

column1: Clear text transmission of sensitive cookie
column2: Sending sensitive information in a cookie without requring SSL encryption can expose the cookie to an attacker.
column4: Sensitive cookie sent without enforcing SSL encryption.

column2: Hard-coding credentials in source code may enable an attacker to gain unauthorized access.
column4: The hard-coded value "keyboard cat" is used as [["key"|"relative:///index.js:18:11:18:24"]].
